column4: a king who had three daughters of surpassing beauty
the red sun, the trees, and the flowers
the freedom of the bright world
a sudden whirlwind seized them and carried them off far and high, no one knew whither
him who should find traces of the princesses
any man who might find them
the princess of his choice in marriage, and a rich dowry
someone from among the common people
a poor widow who had three sons
a little man as big as a thumb, with a beard a cubit long
the old man as big as a thumb, with a beard a cubit long
the old man as big as a thumb, with a beard a cubit long
the old man as big as a thumb
a deep hole in the ground
a phial with the water of strength
Dawn drank the phial of water and felt great power in himself
all of the dragon's three heads
a long time or a short time
the same thing: they rolled up their kingdoms into eggs, took them, and all of them went to the hole
a copper, a silver and a golden one
a copper, a silver and a golden one
